qas.question: When did World War II start?
How many groups were involved in conflict of World War II?
Who made up the Axis powers?
Who were the winners of World War II?
The winners of World War II along with France were allotted permanent seats for what organization?
What trusteeship of the powerful started in 1939?

plausible_answers.text: the Allies (the United Kingdom and France at first in Europe, China in Asia

qas.question: Who made up the permanent seats alliances since 1937?
What was Germany, Italy and Japan  and France recognized as by the UN in 1942?
What were four alliances in WWII referred to?
Who was part of the inclusion powers?

context: When <b5_0>World War II<b5_0/> started in <a0_0>1939<a0_0/>, it divided the world into <a1_0>two alliances<a1_0/>—<b6_0>the Allies (the United Kingdom and France at first in Europe, China in Asia<b6_0/> since 1937, followed in 1941 by the Soviet Union, the United States); and the Axis powers consisting of <a2_0><b9_0>Germany, Italy and Japan<b9_0/><a2_0/>.[nb 1] During World War II, the United States, United Kingdom, and Soviet Union controlled Allied policy and emerged as the "Big Three". The Republic of China and the Big Three were referred as a "trusteeship of the powerful"  and were recognized as <b7_0>the Allied "Big Four"<b7_0/> in Declaration by United Nations in 1942. These four countries were referred as the <b8_0>"Four Policemen"<b8_0/> of the <a3_0>Allies<a3_0/> and considered as the primary victors of World War II. The importance of France was acknowledged by their inclusion, along with the other four, in the group of countries allotted permanent seats in the <a4_0>United Nations Security Council<a4_0/>.
